reviews.text: Pretty much what you'd expect. Somewhat basic, corridors are decorated like a youth hostel, but the bed is comfortable and spacious, the shower is good and I was not disturbed by noise from inside or outside the hotel. They lose a star though because there was an intermittent and very loud drainage noise coming from the shower drain, that seemed to be related to usage by other rooms. I guess it means there is no trap/S-bend in the drain? I'm any case, I was able to remove the drain cap and stuff a towel in there, which made the noise acceptable.

It was a good experience in general. After 7 hours of traveling time it was a little tough to wait for the lady who was on the phone with a colleague for 10 minutes while we wait in front of her. We were given a room with an awful smell but we're changed to another when requested.

Excellent room, good storage to hang clothes with plenty of hangers, spotless bathroom, very good breakfast with hot option and helpful receptionist. We needed transport advice and she took the time to help us

I wasn’t expecting luxury but this was extremely basic! The twin beds were so narrow it was impossible to get comfortable and we had little sleep. There were no tea and coffee facilities in the room, only a vending machine in the lobby which wasn’t working properly. My husband paid for tea twice and got a cup of hot water twice. Luckily we’d packed tea bags for our trip so he was still able to get a cup of tea. I’d rather pay a little more for a better room but booking from the UK it’s a little hard to judge what you are getting.

When I arrived at 2:00am after a long 14 hour drive, my room was  occupied by someone else.  So I went to the front desk again and asked for a vacant room.  I was given a vacant room and finally fell asleep at 3:00am.  However, the following morning at 10:30am the manager pounded on my door and demanded that I vacate the room immediately.  She shouted at me and didn't bother to identify herself.  I was totally bewildered and dazed.   I told her I would be out in 30 minutes.  When I came out to the front desk between 11:00 and 11:30 she gave me coffee and another room. I was exhausted. Later, around 1:00pm, the same manager with her horrific thick round glasses which made her appearance all the more menacing proceeded to double charge me for the additional room.  I tried to explained to her what happened but she yelled at the top of her lungs and said she didn't want to hear what I had to say and that she knew what I was going to say.  She screamed and said if I didn't pay for the room which by the way was sitting vacant at 2:00am when I arrived and available to rent the following day by noon, that she would kick our entire tour party out of the hotel.  So I paid the $102 Euros for the room - which she said was 50% off.  I now see it now listed for $55 on the Internet.  So I got screwed there.  She is a total disaster of a human. I could see the entire staff of the hotel lives in fear of her and her explosive nature.  I truly feel sorry for her.  I believe somewhere inside her is a kind person however she clearly feels that in order to make her way in the world she must be in her masculine and be a full blown bully.  Readers of this review would be advised to avoid this hotel for at least 12 months from posting and/or until the entire staff gets training and recovers from her nastiness. Also my room didn't have a waste basket and when I asked for one, it was "impossible".  There is a top down problem with this hotel.   Lastly, I didn't like the location of the hotel as it is not in the best area and unsafe at night.  You definitely can't walk around there at night.
